definition: to stray especially from a standard, principle, or topic
to depart from an established course or norm
examples: a flight forced by weather to deviate south
rarely deviates from his usual routine
behaviors that deviate from the norm

definition: to cause to turn out of a previous course
examples: he would deviate rivers, turn the scorched plains … into fertile pastures

definition: one that deviates from a norm, a person who differs markedly from a group norm
a statistical variable that gives the deviation (see deviation sense b) of another variable from a fixed value (such as the mean)
departing significantly from the behavioral norms (see norm sense 2) of a particular society
